alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, southwestern DeSoto, Tunica and northwestern Tate Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Tunica, or 15 miles northeast of St Francis National Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tunica, North Tunica, Phillipp, Dubbs, Robinsonville, Little Texas, Trinity, Dooley, Savage, Fox Island, Commerce, Austin, Peters, Clayton, Council, Hollywood, Lost Lake, Prichard, Diamond Woods and Banks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
